channel.title: Blogs on Ankur Bhagwath
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Ankur Bhagwath

item.title: Comparing R to Python
item.description: Hello! Today, we’ll be looking at the differences in R and Python to do simple statistical tasks. At first, it might seem to be a little scary: But it’s really not! Just like a raccoon at night, what appears to be scary is actually quite docile. First, we want to bring in the Reticulate package, to convert between R and Python: among other packages. library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
